https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/58240/ : SUCCESS
Are we going to get any test cases for any of this code?

We have a functional tests for VM. Making it available outside is a topic for other discussion though.
No unit tests are available at the moment.

I don't find this a particularly acceptable answer.  You're going to be adding a bunch of code and nobody has any way to test it except your team?  How can anyone contribute to it?  How are you going to be able to accept even trivial fixes to this code without slowing down the project by saying "I need to test this first"?

New code should have unit tests at a minimum.  Integration tests in openbmc-test-automation is an additional bonus.
Unit tests are "under construction" (i.e. we've already started implementation) and will be available as soon as possible. We're just not ready to publish them yet.
That is good, but I would prefer we don't accept this code into upstream until unit tests are available.  Those should be co-developed with the original code.

We use it for debugging to see events and states transitions printed out "human readable". 
BasicEvent is just for avoid duplication of name field. With removed virtual function I would prefer the rest to leave it as is to avoid complication of such simple thing.
__func__.  __FUNCTION__ is a deprecated GCC extension.  __func__ is part of the C++ standard.
Sure, I will change to __func__ or even use boost/function_name.hpp for better portability.
What???  Why do you even have BasicEvent if you're going to use variant instead?  You've now got the overhead of _both_ a virtual function table AND the variant-visitor stuff.  Pick one.
Removed virtual destructor. See answer above.
Taking a pause from reviewing here...
